main event: A round yellow object, the size of a basketball, was observed moving slowly back and forth in Bedford, Ohio on March 4, 1956.
interesting points: The observation lasted an unknown length of time., The object moved 1 mile back and forth from the initial sighting., The object revolved, with one side appearing dimmer than the other., The sighting involved binoculars for better visibility., Insufficient data prevented a conclusive analysis.
sighted object: a round yellow object the size of a basketball
witness description: George Wagasky Jr, Operations and Intelligence Officer
